revised_title: Improvement and Advantages of the Vertical Floating Collimator in Astronomical Observations
tldr: The author, Henry Kater, describes a new vertical floating collimator that improves upon the horizontal floating collimator. This instrument can be used with a circle or a zenith telescope, making it more versatile and accurate for astronomical observations. The vertical floating collimator offers a faster and more precise method for determining the zenith point, potentially replacing the use of levels and plumb lines in celestial observations.
